title: **Harvest of mouse spleens and preparation of splenic sections**

body: Harvest mouse spleens, embed them in OCT compound embedding medium and freeze in liquid nitrogen.
Cut 7 µm sections and mount them on Superfrost Plus slides.
Incubate slides in humidified chambers overnight at 4 ˚C and dry them, then fix them in acetone at 4 ˚C for 10 min and block them with PBS + 5% fetal calf serum at 25 ˚C for 1 h.

Stain blocked sections overnight at 4 ˚C with a combination of anti-CD3-phycoerythrin, anti-B220-FITC, and peanut-agglutinin-biotin, all diluted in blocking buffer \(all the antibodies need to be titrated for optimal results; dilution 1:200 – 1:1000) \(1).
Wash the slides 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween

body.body: Stain sections with streptavidin-cyanin 5.5 \(dilution 1:100) at 25 ˚C for 1 h.

body: Wash the slides 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20, dry them and mount them with Gelmount.
Capture images at x10 magnification with a Zeiss Axioplan microscope.
